issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
Seen when running TestEncryptedHDFSCliDriver, at least with Hadoop 2.7.2 (HIVE-13930). 

Looks like such issues are usually caused by concurrent db creation from multiple threads.
{noformat}

fields.summary: Acid DB creation error in HiveQA

comments.body:
why would there be parallel threads creating the same DB?
I thought UTs are supposed to run sequentially (on a given machine)

That's weird. TestEncryptdHDFSCliDriver is just a clone of TestCliDriver that prepares encryption during the tests. But all tests are run sequentially as other tests do.

I found there is one test that runs queries in parallel, I don't know if it has something to do with this. Test is {{TestMTQueries}}
